content:
Matys Hoffman said
Could you please let me know if thereâ€™s a way to: Force an existing POP account to switch to IMAP, Or safely recreate the account as IMAP without losing local data and without Thunderbird freezing during setup?

1. No.

2. The new Account Hub has some bugs - try creating the new IMAP account the old way:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Account hub > uncheck 'Create accounts in the new Account Hub'

- go to TB menu > New Account > Email

Once it's created and you confirm it's working OK, delete the POP account.

content:
Ed said
Passkey isn't supported yet. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1864917

Oh. That's a bummer.

I guess I'll need to do what I've done with other accounts and that is create a password, log in and allow access to my account and then enable passwordless. All this seems to work, at least it has on all my other accounts.
creator: adelphiaUK

content: Itâ€™s smart to be cautious if the upgrade screen looks unusual and asks for your password. It could be legitimate, but to be safe, try upgrading via the terminal with `sudo apt update` and `sudo apt upgrade` to avoid suspicious pop-ups. If the screen still seems off, donâ€™t enter your password and cancel the upgrade. Always trust your instincts with password requests.

content:
The mobile version of Thunderbird does not support rich text formatting (HTML) or images into signatures.

You can use HTML or Image signatures with the desktop version Signatures.
creator: norhorn

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: OK, found the culprit. The bottom bar disappears when I have "Tasks and events" selected in the Today pane. In Tasks only view, the bottom bar displays correctly.

content: I presume this is an IMAP account. Please log onto your online account to verify that the account's content has been preserved with your folders. And, please share more details, such as : did the server name change? did the email address change? thank you.

content: OK, let's continue. what is the email domain (the part of email address to the right of the @ sign? if you click to 'account settings pane and click the 'Server Settings' link under the account name in left sidebar. That will display the server type (POP or IMAP) You stated the tech support person told you to delete your account and start a new one. What did you do in starting a new email address? Did you remove the old account from Thunderbird?

Good luck, remain WELL & be SAFE!

content: Just an observation: when thunderbird is showing your account, that is not a copy; it's the real account. So, why not just use Thunderbird to do all of that, since it is easier (in my opinion) than using a web interface? It also saves time from attempting to keep in two different places.
creator: davidsk
